definition: a periodic and often annually recurring state of certain male animals (such as deer or elk) during which behavior associated with the urge to breed is displayed
the period of time during which rut occurs : breeding season
to be in or enter into a state of rut
a track worn by a wheel or by habitual passage
a groove in which something runs
a usual or fixed practice, a monotonous routine
examples: fall easily into a conversational rut

definition: to make a rut in : furrow
